trans-unit.source: Represents an application that is available for use with the Peer Collaboration infrastructure.
An application is a set of software or software features available to a peer from an endpoint.
Commonly, this refers to network-enabled software packages such as games or other collaborative applications.

A <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication> defines the set of software applications or components available for use with the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerCollaboration> network.
This network enables infrastructure participants to initiate usage of this application.
They may initiate a collaboration session using the application identified by this class.
After constructing an instance of this class and setting the appropriate properties, this object may be used in <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer> collaboration sessions.

Its use is accomplished by passing it to the peer collaboration <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerCollaboration.RegisterApplication%2A> and <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerCollaboration.UnregisterApplication%2A> methods, which will enable or disable it.

The globally unique <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication.Id%2A> and <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplicationRegistrationType> properties of this instance must be set before the application can successfully be registered.
After registering an application with the Peer Collaboration infrastructure, the registration information persists in the registry.
This makes the application available to collaboration applications even after the program which registered the application has exited.
Changing the properties on an application instance after it has been registered has no effect on the registration.
To update the registration, the application must be deregistered and then registered again with the new information.
Initializes a new default instance of the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> type.

The globally unique <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication.Id%2A> and <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplicationRegistrationType> properties of this instance must be set before the application can successfully be registered.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> type with the data required for serialization.
Returns a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication> object with a name fully qualified by the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerName> object within it.

The globally unique <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication.Id%2A> and <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplicationRegistrationType> properties of this instance must be set before the application can successfully be registered.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>.
The serialization destination associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint"></xref>.
Initializes a new <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> instance with the supplied application ID, description, scope, and data elements.

The globally unique <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication.Id%2A> and <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplicationRegistrationType> properties of this instance must be set before the application can successfully be registered.
A user-specified <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> used to identify the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> description of the peer application.
A binary data object to associate with the peer application, such as a small image.
The local file system path to the peer application.
Command-line arguments for starting the peer application.
The scope in which the application will be registered for peer collaboration.
Length of the binary data object cannot be less than one or greater than 16k.
- id is set to `null`.
This event is raised whenever a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> is added, updated or deleted by a remote peer on a subscribed endpoint.

Use of this event requires a value of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted> in the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerCollaborationPermission> object that was created when the peer collaboration session began.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> object has been disposed.
Gets or sets command-line parameters to use when initiating a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref>.
<xref href="System.String"></xref> that represents application-specific command-line parameters to use when initiating the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> object has been disposed.
Gets or sets data associated with the current <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> instance.
This data is free form and is provided by the hosting peer.
The maximum amount of data that can be provided is 4,096 bytes.
This data is not part of a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication> invitation, but rather allows additional data to be associated with the application on the local peer.
Array of <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> data that contain a binary object to associate with the peer application.
This is commonly a small image or XML blob.
The size of this binary data object is either less than 0 or greater than 4,096 bytes.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> object has been disposed.
Gets or sets a Unicode <xref href="System.String"></xref> that describes the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref>.
This data is not part of a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication> invitation.
However, it is displayed on the user interface when a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.Peer> receives an invitation for the application.
<xref href="System.String"></xref> value that describes the application.
Unless specified, the default value for this property is `null`.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> object has been disposed.
Releases resources used by the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> object.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> object and optionally releases the managed resources.
Set to `true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> objects are considered equal.
The first <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> to compare.

Returns `true` if the specified objects have the same globally unique application <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication.Id"></xref> and <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication.Description"></xref>, else `false`.
Compares the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> to the specified <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to test for equality.
Returns `true` if the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> is equal to the specified object instance, else `false`.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> has been disposed.
Compares the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> to the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> instance.
No normalizations are performed on the strings prior to comparison.
All normalization should have been completed while or before constructing the PeerApplication objects.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> instance to test for equality.
Returns `true` if the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> instance provided has matching data, else `false`.
This method also returns `false` if other is `null`.
This <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> object has been disposed.
Returns the hash code for a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> instance.
A 32-bit signed integer hash code used to compare instances of this type.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> object has been disposed.
Populates a <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> with the data needed to serialize the target <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> to populate with data.
The destination for this serialization.
Gets or sets the user-defined <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref>.
`Null` items are not allowed.
<xref href="System.Guid"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> instance.
Unless specified, the default value for this property is `null`.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> object has been disposed.
Raises the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication.ApplicationChanged"></xref> event.
Classes that inherit from this class can override this delegate to perform additional tasks when the event occurs.

The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ApplicationChangedEventArgs"></xref> object that contains data to be passed to delegates for the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication.ApplicationChanged"></xref> event.
Gets or sets the path that designates where the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> executable file resides on the local file system.
`Null` or <xref:System.String.Empty> values are not allowed.
<xref href="System.String"></xref> that represents the file path.
Unless explicitly specified, the default value for this property is `null`.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> object has been disposed.
Gets or sets the scope in which the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> is registered for collaboration.

<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerScope"></xref> object that specifies the scope in which the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> will collaborate.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> object has been disposed.

When this property value is set, all events not fired as the result of an asynchronous operation will have the associated event handlers called back on the thread that created the specific <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint.SynchronizingObject"></xref>.
The default set value for this property is `null`, indicating that all event handlers are called on a system thread pool thread.
This property is typically set to a UI element such as a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> instance.

Object that implements the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ISynchronizeInvoke"></xref> interface and is used by instances of this type for event handler synchronization on the thread that created it.
The calling object has been disposed.

Returns a string that contains the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication.Id"></xref> and <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication.Description"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> instance.
This method inherits the default signature and behavior from <xref:System.Object>.

A string that contains the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication.Id"></xref> and <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication.Description"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> instance, separated by a space.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> object has been disposed.

Implements the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable"></xref> interface and returns the data required to serialize the target <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object to populate with data.
The destination for this serialization.
